com.swirl

Class Swirl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirl.Swirl

  • public class Swirl
extends java.lang.Object
    The Swirl class is the main entry point into the Swirl proximity sdk for delivery of proximity and content events to your app. You use a singleton instance of this class to start: and stop proximity detection and delivery of proximity events. It supports a multi-delegate interface so you can add one or many delegate objects to receive callbacks from any of the protocols broadcast to the multi-delegate bus. - SWRLSwirlDelegate for state updates about sdk state - SWRLBeaconScannerDelegate for beacon advertisement callbacks - SWRLBeaconManagerDelegate for beacon calbacks (enter, exit, closest, dwell) - SWRLWifiManagerDelegate for wifi calbacks (enter, exit) - SWRLRegionManagerDelegate for region (geofence) calbacks (enter, exit) - SWRLVisitManagerDelegate for visit calbacks (begin, end, dwell) - SWRLContentManagerDelegate for content calbacks (receive content)

      • addListener

        public Swirl addListener(java.lang.Object listener)
        Add a listener to the internal listener bus. Listeners are added to the internal multicast listener bus and can receive messages from any of the listed interfaces (see x). Listeners added via this method are added using the main executor. This function simply calls addListener(Object,Executor) with the result of **executor** as the executor argument. If the existing listener has already been added, this function takes no action.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object to receive listener callbacks. This parameter must not be `null`.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance
        See Also:
        removeListener(Object), addListener(Object, Executor)

      • addListener

        public Swirl addListener(java.lang.Object listener,
                         java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Add a listener to the internal listener bus, specifying an executor. Listeners are added to the internal multicast listener bus and can receive messages from any of the listed interfaces (see x). All messages dispatched to this listener will be delivered on the executor specified. If the existing listener has already been added, this function takes no action.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object to receive listener callbacks. This parameter must not be `null`.
        executor - The executor on which messages should be delivered. This parameter must not be `null`.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance
        See Also:
        removeListener(Object), addListener(Object)

      • removeListener

        public Swirl removeListener(java.lang.Object listener)
        Remove a listener that had been previously added via addListener(). If the listener is not present, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object to receive listener callbacks. This parameter must not be `null`.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance
        See Also:
        addListener(Object), addListener(Object, Executor)

        Log event to the log stream.
        Parameters:

        data - The data for event (see the list of events)
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance

      • reset

        public Swirl reset()
        Removes all locally stored data and state. If the sdk is currently running, it will call stop first. After calling this function, the sdk will be in a stopped state.
        Returns:
        this Swirl instance
